content.en: Bipedal robot optimization: Researchers are using complex optimization theory and genetic algorithms to address problems in the gait planning and energy efficiency of biped robots. These algorithms are being used to optimize joint trajectories, minimize energy consumption, generate optimal walking patterns, and design controllers for bipedal robots. Additionally, computational intelligent methods and bio-inspired gait planning are being explored to improve the walking motions of biped robots.
content.da: To-benet robotoptimering: Forskere bruger kompleks optimeringsteori og genetiske algoritmer til at tackle problemer i gangplanlægning og energieffektivitet for to-benede robotter. Disse algoritmer bruges til at optimere ledtrajektorier, minimere energiforbrug, generere optimale gangmønstre og designe controllere til to-benede robotter. Derudover udforskes beregningsintelligente metoder og bio-inspireret gangplanlægning for at forbedre gangbevægelserne for to-benede robotter.
